body.sentence: node
Monolayer differentiation of naïve hPSCs

Prepare 6-well culture plates coated with a 0.2% gelatin solution and incubate at 37°C for at least 30
min before preparing the cells.

At ~60% confluency, dissociate naïve hPSCs into single cells by incubating in TrypLE Express solution
at 37 °C for ~3 min.
Resuspend the cells in 5iLA or PXGL media and centrifuge at 200 g for 3 min
Remove the supernatant and resuspend cells in 2 mL of 5iLA or PXGL media

Transfer the cell suspension into the prepared gelatin-coated 6-well plate and incubate at 37 °C for 30
min to remove MEF cells.

Collect and re-plate the supernatant containing naïve hPSCs into a 12-well plate (1 × 10
5 cells/well*)
pre-coated with Matrigel in 5iLA or PXGL media.

HDM followed by hTSM method: after 1 day of culture in 5iLA or PXGL media, change the medium to
HDM and culture for an additional 3 days, then change the medium to hTSM and culture for an additional
6 days

hTSM followed by HDM method: after 1 day of culture in 5iLA or PXGL media, change the medium to
hTSM and culture for 6 days, then change the medium to HDM and culture for 3 days.
Confirm lineage marker expression after 9 days of differentiation by immunostaining.

Prepare 6-well culture plates coated with a 0.2% gelatin solution and incubate at 37 °C for at least 30
min before using.

Prepare an AggreWell™400 plate according to manufacturer instructions. Briefly, add anti-adhesion
rinsing solution to the wells, centrifuge at 2,000 g for 5 min, and then incubate at room temperature for at
least 10 min.

At ~60% confluency, dissociate naïve hPSCs into single cells by incubating cells in TrypLE Express
solution at 37 °C for ~3 min.
Resuspend the cells in 5iLA or PXGL media and centrifuge at 200 g for 3 min.
Remove the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 2 mL of 5iLA or PXGL media.

Transfer the cell suspension into a gelatin coated 6-well plate and incubate at 37 °C for 30 min to
remove MEF cells
Collect the supernatant containing naïve hPSCs and filter them through a 40 μm cell strainer.

Remove the anti-adhesion rinsing solution from the Aggrewell™400, wash the wells with 5iLA or PXGL
media once, and then add 0.5 mL of 5iLA or PXGL media to each well.

Count the number of naïve hPSCs, and transfer ~30,000 cells (~25 cells/microwell)* to 1 mL of 5iLA
or PXGL media.
Transfer 1 mL of the cell suspension into one well of a prepared Aggrewell™400 plate. The total volume in the well should now be 1.5 mL.

Centrifuge the Aggrewell plate at 100 g for 1 min and place it in an incubator maintained at 37 °C and
5% CO2
. Proceed to step 12 (HT method) or step 15 (TH method).

After 12 hours of culture, carefully remove as much 5iLA or PXGL media from the well as possible,
and then add 1.5 mL of HDM. This is designated as day 1. Replace with fresh HDM media on day 2.

After 2-3* days of culture in HDM, carefully remove as much medium as possible, and then add 1 mL
of TDM. Then carefully remove as much medium as possible (in order to completely remove HDM) (this
can be repeated for 1-2 more times). Finally, add 1.5 mL of fresh TDM to the well. Replace media with
fresh TDM every other days.
After 6-8* days of culture in TDM, cavity structures can be observed in some microwells.

After 12 hours of culture, carefully remove as much 5iLA or PXGL media from the well as possible,
and then add 1.5 mL of TDM. This is designated as day 1. Replace with fresh TDM media every other
days.

After 6-8* days of culture in TDM cavity structures can be observed in some microwells. Carefully
remove as much medium as possible and then add 1 mL of HDM. Then carefully remove as much
medium as possible (in order to completely remove TDM) (this can be repeated for 1-2 more times).
Finally, add 1.5 mL of fresh HDM to the well and culture for an additional 1-2 days.

Once cavity-containing structures have formed, harvest all cell aggregates from the microwells by
gently pipetting up and down for 1–2 times with a 1000 uL pipette tip*

Once cavity-containing structures have formed, harvest all cell aggregates from the microwells by
gently pipetting up and down for 1–2 times with a 1000 uL pipette tip*
